info.title: Protocol "D"
info.subtitle: TCP/IP Protocol for controlling the dynamic routing engine

sect1.title: Overview
sect1.para: Messages to the DRouter dynamic routing service are by means of a TCP SOCK_STREAM connection to TCP port 23883 on the host server.
Messages have the following general syntax:

listitem.para: A single word, containing no whitespace, case-insensitive.
Zero or more arguments, delimited by a TAB character (ASCII 9).
The ASCII character CR (13) followed by LF (10).

sect1.title: Connection Management
sect1.para: Messages for managing connections to the service.

sect2.title: Exit
sect2.para: Drop the TCP connection and end the session.

sect2.title: Ping
sect2.para: Causes the remote end to return a PONG message.

sect1.title: Information
sect1.para: Messages for enumerating resources and getting system information.

sect2.title: List Destinations
sect2.para: Return a list of records delinieating the currently available destinations, terminated by CR/LF. Each record contains the following fields, delimited by TAB (ASCII 9):

listitem.para: The string DST.
The IPv4 address of the parent node, in dotted-quad notation.
The slot position number of the destination on the parent node (zero-based).
The host name of the parent node. Depending upon system configuration, this could be the name as programmed in the node or the name as reported via a DNS PTR lookup.
The IPv4 address of the stream configured to be received, in dotted-quad notation.
The name of the destination.
The number of channels capable of being received by this destination. Possible values include 1, 2 or 8.

sect2.title: List GPIs
sect2.para: Return a list of records delinieating the currently available GPIs, terminated by CR/LF. Each record contains the following fields, delimited by TAB (ASCII 9):

listitem.para: The string GPI.
The IPv4 address of the parent node, in dotted-quad notation.
The slot position number of the GPI on the parent node (zero-based).
The host name of the parent node. Depending upon system configuration, this could be the name as programmed in the node or the name as reported via a DNS PTR lookup.
The state of the GPI lines, in the format xxxxx.

sect2.title: List GPOs
sect2.para: Return a list of records delinieating the currently available GPOs, terminated by CR/LF. Each record contains the following fields, delimited by TAB (ASCII 9):

listitem.para: The string GPO.
The IPv4 address of the parent node, in dotted-quad notation.
The slot position number of the GPO on the parent node (zero-based).
The host name of the parent node. Depending upon system configuration, this could be the name as programmed in the node or the name as reported via a DNS PTR lookup.
The state of the GPO lines, in the format xxxxx.
The name of the GPO entry.
The IPv4 address of the source GPI node, in dotted-quad notation.
The slot position number of the source GPI on the source node (zero-based).

sect2.title: List Nodes
sect2.para: Return a list of records delinieating the currently available nodes, terminated by CR/LF. Each record contains the following fields, delimited by TAB (ASCII 9):

listitem.para: The string NODE.
The IPv4 address of the node, in dotted-quad notation.
The host name of the node. Depending upon system configuration, this could be the name as programmed in the node or the name as reported via a DNS PTR lookup.
The LWRP device name.
The number of source slot positions.
The number of destination slot positions.
The number of GPI slot positions.
The number of GPO slot positions.

sect2.title: List Sources
sect2.para: Return a list of SRC records, delinieating the currently available sources, terminated by CR/LF. Each record contains the following fields, delimited by TAB (ASCII 9):

listitem.para: The string SRC.
The IPv4 address of the parent node, in dotted-quad notation.
The slot position number of the source on the parent node (zero-based).
The host name of the parent node. Depending upon system configuration, this could be the name as programmed in the node or the name as reported via a DNS PTR lookup.
The IPv4 stream address in dotted-quad notation.
The name of the stream.
The current state of the stream. 1 if enabled or 0 if disabled.
The number of channels being carried by the stream. Possible values include 1, 2 or 8.
The number of PCM24 frames carried by each RTP packet. Possible values include 12 (Live Stereo), 60 (8 Channel Surround) and 240 (Standard Stereo/Mono).

sect2.title: Subscribe Destinations
sect2.para: Return a list of DSTADD records delinieating the currently available destinations, each record terminated by CR/LF (see the description of the DST message in the ListDestinations command for a breakdown of the supplied fields). Whenever a new destination is added, a corresponding DSTADD record will be sent, while changes to an existing destination will cause a DST record to be sent. Removal of a destination from the system will generate a corresponding DSTDEL record, containing the following fields:

listitem.para: The string DSTDEL.
The IPv4 address of the parent node, in dotted-quad notation.
The slot position number of the destination on the parent node (zero-based).

sect2.title: Subscribe GPIs
sect2.para: Return a list of GPIADD records delinieating the currently available GPIs, each record terminated by CR/LF (see the description of the GPI message in the ListGpis command for a breakdown of the supplied fields). Whenever a new GPI is added, a corresponding GPIADD record will be sent, while changes to an existing GPI will cause a GPI record to be sent. Removal of a GPI from the system will generate a corresponding GPIDEL record, containing the following fields:

listitem.para: The string GPIDEL.
The IPv4 address of the parent node, in dotted-quad notation.
The slot position number of the GPI on the parent node (zero-based).

sect2.title: Subscribe GPOs
sect2.para: Return a list of GPOADD records delinieating the currently available GPOs, each record terminated by CR/LF (see the description of the GPO message in the ListGpos command for a breakdown of the supplied fields). Whenever a new GPO is added, a corresponding GPOADD record will be sent, while changes to an existing GPO will cause a GPO record to be sent. Removal of a GPO from the system will generate a corresponding GPODEL record, containing the following fields:

listitem.para: The string GPODEL.
The IPv4 address of the parent node, in dotted-quad notation.
The slot position number of the GPO on the parent node (zero-based).

sect2.title: Subscribe Nodes
sect2.para: Return a list of NODEADD records delineating the currently available nodes, each record terminated by CR/LF. Subsequently, for each newly detected node, a corresponding NODEADD record will be sent, while changes to an existing node will cause a NODE record to be sent. Removal of a node from the system will generate a corresponding NODEDEL record with the following fields:

listitem.para: The string NODEDEL.
The IPv4 address of the node, in dotted-quad notation.

sect2.title: Subscribe Sources
sect2.para: Return a list of SRCADD records delinieating the currently available sources, each record terminated by CR/LF (see the description of the SRC message in the ListSources command for a breakdown of the supplied fields). Whenever a new source is added, a corresponding SRCADD record will be sent, while changes to an existing source will cause a SRC record to be sent. Removal of a source from the system will generate a corresponding SRCDEL record, containing the following fields:

listitem.para: The string SRCDEL.
The IPv4 address of the parent node, in dotted-quad notation.
The slot position number of the source on the parent node (zero-based).

sect1.title: Commands
sect1.para: Messages for changing the state of managed resources.

sect2.title: Clear Crosspoint
sect2.para: Clear the source to be received by a destination --i.e. mute the destination.

listitem.para: The IPv4 address of the destination node, in dotted-quad notation.
The slot position number of the destination on the parent node (zero-based).

sect2.title: Set Crosspoint
sect2.para: Set the source to be received by a destination.

listitem.para: The IPv4 address of the destination node, in dotted-quad notation.
The slot position number of the destination on the parent node (zero-based).
The IPv4 address of the source node, in dotted-quad notation.
The slot position number of the source on the parent node (zero-based).
